alert.note: Alert for Itasca; Koochiching (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following areas, in north central Minnesota, Itasca and Koochiching. In northeast Minnesota, Cook, Lake and St. Louis. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 338 PM CDT, gauge reports and forest service officials indicated snowmelt. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Forest service reported ponding of water in ditches and along the edge of roads. Water was leading to washouts along forest roads in the Tofte and Gunflint Ranger districts as of Thursday afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hibbing, International Falls, Ely, Grand Marais, Lake Vermilion, Gunflint Lake, Virginia, Chisholm, Two Harbors, Eveleth, Mountain Iron, Hoyt Lakes, Silver Bay, Gilbert, Aurora, Babbitt, Keewatin, Buhl, Nashwauk and Biwabik. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.
